About.Name: Jacob Ray
About.AboutText:
Hi, I am Jacob Ray. I am a computer engineering student with a deep interest in embedded systems. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am actively expanding my knowledge and skills as I continually explore my interests, including embedded linux and real-time embedded systems.

I enjoy learning and am fascinated by technology and the ways in which we are applying it to all sorts of purposes.

Experience.ExperienceText: I'm currently pursuing my studies and exploring my interests, including embedded systems and FPGAs for digital design, in my spare time.
Experience.EmploymentText: Use this to add some narrative to your employment section

Project1.Title: Sallen Key Bandpass Filter Indicator
Project1.Desc: In this project, I designed and optimized a 4th-order Sallen-Key bandpass filter for an IR system, tuned to 17 kHz with at least -12 dB attenuation at 10 kHz and 25 kHz. I first derived a filter based on a transfer function tested in MATLAB, before subsequently simulating in Multisim with an AC sweep and building the filter. From there, I utilized the digital oscilloscopes FRA to test my physical circuit. Afterwards, I integrated a peak detector and comparator to detect passing signals and to trigger an LED indicator that would only pass when the input has the correct frequency. I validated each step of the process with osilloscope analysis, ensuring that the results are what I expected.
